page.title: 08 Local History_Lentran
page.content: Lentran is a place where older people still remember a meal mill, a bobbin mill, a blacksmith's shop and a police station, but now we find none of them. Originally, the police station was at Drumchardine but later shifted to Kirkhill. There are many self contained houses in Lentran; one of which is Berryfield. The name Lentran means"the meadow of corn crakes,"and they often used to be heard in the neighbourhood though not so frequent lately. The Lentran estate is the property of a former provost of Inverness and his house dates back to 1866 when it was built by a London Stock broker,H.E. White.However one native remembers the house destroyed by fire and this date was of the present building, and not the original one.
